1.verse: Introduction -Chapter 1 -Address. -Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, and Timothy our brother,

2.verse: to the saints and faithful brethren in Christ in Colossae. May God our Father grant you grace and peace.

3.verse: A Community Pervaded by the Gospel. -In all our prayers for you we always give thanks to God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ,

4.verse: because we have heard of your faith in Christ Jesus and of the love that you have for all the saints

5.verse: because of the hope that is stored up for you in heaven. You had learned of this hope through the word of truth, the gospel,

6.verse: that has come down to you.Just as it is bearing fruit and growing throughout the entire world, so it has been bearing fruit among you, ever since the day when you heard it and came to understand the grace of God in truth.

7.verse: You learned this from Epaphras, our beloved fellow servant and a faithful minister of Christ on your behalf.

8.verse: He was also the one who made known to us your love in the Spirit.

9.verse: That is why, ever since the day we first heard about it, we have not ceased to pray for you and to ask that you may be filled with the knowledge of God’s will through all spiritual wisdom and understanding.

10.verse: And we ask this so that you may live in a manner worthy of the Lord and become fully pleasing to him, bearing fruit in every good work and continuing to grow in the knowledge of God.

11.verse: May you be fortified with the strength that comes from his glorious power, and may you be granted patience and endurance, while joyfully

12.verse: giving thanks to the Father who has enabled you to share in the inheritance of the saints in light.

13.verse: He has rescued us from the power of darkness and brought us into the kingdom of his beloved Son,

14.verse: in whom we have redemption, the forgiveness of sins.

15.verse: The Supremacy of Christ -In Christ, through Him, and for Him -He is the image of the invisible God,the firstborn of all creation.

16.verse: For in him were created all thingsin heaven and on earth,whether visible or invisible,whether thrones or dominions or rulers or powers—all things were created through him and for him.

17.verse: He exists before all things,and in him all things hold together.

18.verse: He is the head of the body,that is, the Church.He is the beginning,the firstborn from the dead,so that in every wayhe should be supreme.

19.verse: For in himit pleased Godto make all fullness dwell,

20.verse: and through himto reconcile all things for him,whether on earth or in heaven,by making peace through his blood of the cross.

21.verse: Christ among the Gentiles. -You yourselves were once alienated and hostile in your intent because of your evil deeds.

22.verse: But now, through Christ’s death in his body of flesh, God has reconciled you to himself so that you may stand holy, blameless, and irreproachable in his presence.

23.verse: However, you must persevere in the faith, firmly grounded and steadfast in your belief, and never allowing yourselves to drift away from the hope of the gospel that you accepted and that has now been proclaimed to every creature under heaven, the gospel of which I, Paul, have become a servant.

24.verse: Christ’s Suffering in His People. -I find great joy at present in suffering for you, and in my own body I am completing the sufferings that still must be undergone by Christ for the sake of his body, the Church.

25.verse: I was made a minister of that Church, with the commission given to me by God to make fully known to you the word of God,

26.verse: the mystery that has been hidden throughout the ages and from past generations but that now has been revealed to his saints.

27.verse: To these God chose to make known how rich is the priceless glory that this mystery brings to the Gentiles—Christ in you, your hope of glory.

28.verse: It is he whom we proclaim, admonishing and instructing everyone in all wisdom so that we may present everyone to Christ in a state of perfection.

29.verse: For this I labor and struggle with all his energy working within me mightily.

1.verse: Chapter 2 -Closely United in Love. -I want you to realize how greatly I am struggling for you as well as for those in Laodicea and all the others who have never seen me face to face.

2.verse: I want their hearts to be encouraged and united in love so that they may grow rich in their complete understanding as they come to the knowledge of the mystery of God, that is, Christ,

3.verse: in whom are hidden all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.

4.verse: I am telling you all this so that no one may deceive you with deceptive arguments.

5.verse: Even if I am not physically present to you, I am with you in spirit, and I rejoice to see your unity and the resolute firmness of your faith in Christ.

6.verse: Instruction about Errors That Are Circulating -Walk in Christ. -Therefore, just as you received Christ Jesus the Lord, continue to walk in him.

7.verse: Be rooted and built up in him, and remain established in the faith as you were taught, overflowing with thanksgiving.

8.verse: Make sure that no one leads you astray with an empty and deceitful philosophy that depends on human tradition and worldly principles, and not on Christ.

9.verse: God Has Given You Life in Christ. -For it is in him that the entire fullness of deity dwells in bodily form,

10.verse: and you share this fullness in him who is the head of every ruler and power.

11.verse: In him also you were circumcised, not with a physical circumcision but with a spiritual stripping away of the old nature with the circumcision of Christ.

12.verse: When you were buried with him in baptism, you were also raised with him through faith in the power of God who raised him from the dead.

13.verse: And even when you were dead in your sins and your flesh was uncircumcised, God gave you new life along with him. He has forgiven us all our sins,

14.verse: erasing the record against us with its decrees that are hostile to us. He set this aside, nailing it to the cross.

15.verse: Disarming the rulers and powers, he made a public spectacle of them, parading them in his triumphal procession.

16.verse: The Reality Is Christ. -Therefore, do not allow anyone to pass judgment on you in regard to what you eat or drink, or about the observance of Festivals, New Moons, or Sabbaths.

17.verse: These are only a shadow of what is to come. The reality is Christ.

18.verse: Do not allow yourself to be declared disqualified by those who revel in false humility and worship angels and visions, their vanity foolishly inflated by a human way of thinking.

19.verse: They are not united with the head, from whom the whole body, supported and held together by its ligaments and sinews, achieves the growth that comes from God.

20.verse: Since you died with Christ to the elemental principles of this world, why are you living in the world as if you were subject to it?

21.verse: “Do not handle!” “Do not taste!” “Do not touch!”

22.verse: All this refers to things that perish as they are used. They are simply human commands and teachings.

23.verse: Rules of this type indeed appear to be wise in promoting self-imposed piety, false humility, and harsh treatment of the body, but they are of no value in combating the flesh.

1.verse: Exhortation To Live as Christians -Chapter 3 -Seek the Things That Are Above. -Therefore, since you have been raised with Christ, seek the things that are above, where Christ is, sitting at God’s right hand.

2.verse: Fix your thoughts on things that are above, not on things that are on the earth,

3.verse: for you have died, and your life is hidden with Christ in God.

4.verse: When Christ, who is your life, appears, then you also will appear with him in glory.

5.verse: A New Self. -And so you should put to death everything in your nature that is earthly: sexual immorality, impurity, passion, evil desires, and greed (which is idolatry).

6.verse: Because of these practices, the wrath of God will fall on those who are disobedient.

7.verse: In the life you formerly lived, you used to do these things.

8.verse: But now you must cast them all aside—anger, rage, malice, slander, and foul language out of your lips.

9.verse: Do not lie to one another, since you have stripped off the old self with its practices

10.verse: and have put on the new self that is being renewed in knowledge after the image of its creator.

11.verse: Now there is no longer Greek and Jew, circumcised and uncircumcised, barbarian and Scythian, slave and free man. Rather, Christ is all and in all.

12.verse: Characteristics of Life in Common. -As God’s chosen ones, holy and beloved, put on compassion, kindness, humility, gentleness, and patience.

13.verse: Bear with one another, and forgive one another if anyone has reason to be offended with another. You must forgive just as the Lord has forgiven you.

14.verse: Over all these put on love, which is the bond of perfection.

15.verse: And let the peace of Christ reign in your hearts, because it was for this that you were called together in one body. Always be thankful.

16.verse: Let the word of Christ with all its richness dwell in you. Teach and admonish one another in all wisdom, singing psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs to God with gratitude in your hearts.

17.verse: And whatever you do in word or deed, do everything in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father through him.

18.verse: The Christian Family. -Wives, be subject to your husbands, as is fitting in the Lord.

19.verse: Husbands, love your wives and do not treat them harshly.

20.verse: Children, obey your parents in everything, for this is pleasing to the Lord.

21.verse: Fathers, do not provoke your children lest they lose heart.

22.verse: Slaves and Masters. -Slaves, obey your earthly masters in everything, not only when you are being observed or in order to please them, but wholeheartedly, out of reverence for the Lord.

23.verse: Whatever you do, do it wholeheartedly, as if you were doing it for the Lord and not for others,

24.verse: since you know that you will receive from the Lord an inheritance as your reward for you are serving the Lord Christ.

25.verse: But anyone who does wrong will be repaid for what he has done. There will not be any favoritism shown.

1.verse: Chapter 4 -Masters, be just and fair in your treatment of your slaves, knowing that you too have a Master in heaven.

2.verse: Assiduous Prayer. -Persevere in prayer, with alert minds and thankful hearts.

3.verse: At the same time, pray for us too, so that God may open a door to us to proclaim the word, the mystery of Christ, for which I am in prison.

4.verse: Pray that I may proclaim it as clearly as I should.

5.verse: Christian Behavior. -Conduct yourselves wisely toward outsiders, making the most of your opportunity.

6.verse: Let your speech always be gracious and seasoned with wisdom, so that you will know how to respond properly to all.

7.verse: Conclusion -Tychicus and Onesimus. -Tychicus will tell you all the news about me. He is a beloved brother, a faithful minister, and a fellow servant in the Lord.

8.verse: I am sending him to you for this very purpose, so that you will know how we are and that he may cheer your hearts.

9.verse: He will be accompanied by Onesimus, our trustworthy and beloved brother, who is one of you. They will tell you about everything that has happened here.

10.verse: Paul’s Coworkers. -Aristarchus, my fellow prisoner, sends you his greetings, as does Mark, the cousin of Barnabas. (You have received instructions about him; if he comes to you, make him welcome.)

11.verse: And Jesus who is called Justus also greets you. Of all those who are of the circumcision, these are the only ones who are working with me for the kingdom of God, and they have been a great comfort to me.

12.verse: Epaphras sends you greetings. He is one of you, a servant of Christ Jesus, and he is always pleading earnestly in his prayers on your behalf so that you may seek perfection and fulfill the will of God.

13.verse: I can testify for him that he has worked tirelessly for you and those in Laodicea and Hierapolis.

14.verse: Luke, the beloved physician, and Demas send you greetings.

15.verse: Notes for the Laodiceans. -Give my greetings to the brethren in Laodicea, and to Nymphas and the Church in her house.

16.verse: Then when this letter has been read to you, see to it that it is also read to the Church at Laodicea; and I ask you in turn to read my letter that is coming from Laodicea.

17.verse: Also tell Archippus: “See that you carry out fully the ministry that you received in the Lord.”

18.verse: Paul’s Signature. -I, Paul, write this farewell in my own hand. Remember my chains. Grace be with you.
